values.undefined: For beauty, it’s not enough to rely solely on artistry and taste. Treatments should be performed systematically. In this case, in addition to the aesthetic aspect, attention has been given to the treatment factors such as the length of the dental crown and the patient’s occlusal relationship.
values.title: A Blend Of Science And Art

In this case, attention has been given not only to the aesthetic aspects but also to functional factors such as the length of the dental crowns and the patient's occlusal relationship.

In order to match the color of the remaining teeth with these full ceramic crowns, ceramic veneers have also been used.

values.title: Soft Tissue Management
values.description1:
Have you ever considered the importance of soft tissues in dentistry? Soft tissues, such as gums and surrounding structures, play a crucial role in the beauty and health of your mouth. Our soft tissue management services at Dr. Ebadian’s Dental Clinic help ensure not only the health of your gums but also enhance the beauty of your smile. These services include advanced treatments for gum issues and soft tissue concerns, which we will discuss in detail below.

 

What Are Soft Tissues and Why Are They Important?

Soft tissues encompass the gums, mucous membranes, and connective tissues surrounding teeth and implants. These tissues not only support the teeth but also play a vital role in the overall aesthetics and health of the mouth. Healthy soft tissues contribute to your smile’s appearance and help maintain the structure of your teeth and jaw. In fact, the quality and condition of these tissues can directly affect your dental health, comfort, and even self-esteem.
values.description2:
Common Soft Tissue Problems

Various issues can affect soft tissues, including:

  1. Gingivitis: This common condition usually arises from the accumulation of plaque and bacteria on the teeth. If untreated, gingivitis can progress to periodontitis, a more severe gum infection that may lead to tooth loss.
  2. Gum Recession: Gum recession refers to the loss of gum tissue, which can expose the roots of the teeth and increase sensitivity to heat and cold. This condition can also negatively impact the aesthetics of your smile.
  3. Soft Tissue Infections: Infections can spread rapidly and require immediate treatment. These infections may result from poor oral hygiene, physical injuries, or specific medical conditions. Prompt intervention is essential to prevent complications.
values.description3:
Our Soft Tissue Management Services

Our soft tissue management services include advanced and effective methods for treating soft tissue issues. These services are designed to enhance both the function and aesthetics of your mouth:

  1. Soft Tissue Grafting

Soft tissue grafting is a procedure where tissue from one area of the body is transferred to another. This method improves the appearance of gums and supports implants. Soft tissue grafting can restore receded gums and enhance overall gum health. This technique is especially beneficial for individuals experiencing gum recession or undergoing dental implant procedures. By using the patient’s own tissue, we minimize the risk of rejection and ensure a natural look.

  1. Treatment of Gum Inflammation

The treatment for gum inflammation involves deep cleaning of the teeth and gums, along with the use of antiseptic medications. This method helps reduce inflammation and infection, improving the health of soft tissues. Regular dental visits for cleanings and check-ups can aid in the prevention of gum issues. By addressing inflammation early, we can help prevent more serious conditions that may arise.

  1. Soft Tissue Stabilization

Techniques for stabilizing soft tissues help protect and support the tissues around implants. These methods prevent recession and infection, increasing the success rates of dental treatments. Utilizing specialized materials and innovative techniques can yield better results, ensuring that your implants and natural teeth remain healthy and functional.

Why Choose Soft Tissue Management?

Soft tissue management not only addresses existing issues but also prevents future problems. Choosing our services enables you to:

  • Maintain Your Smile’s Aesthetic: By improving gum conditions, your smile will appear more natural and beautiful. A lovely smile can positively impact your self-confidence and overall quality of life.
  • Enhance Your Oral Health: Preventing soft tissue problems ensures the overall health of your mouth and teeth. Healthy soft tissues can help avert more serious issues, such as gum disease, which can have systemic effects on your health.
  • Enjoy Greater Comfort and Confidence: Treating soft tissue issues allows you to smile with more confidence. A beautiful smile can facilitate better social interactions and enhance your overall happiness.

Key Tips for Maintaining Soft Tissues

To preserve the health of your soft tissues, consider the following key tips:

  • Oral Hygiene: Regular brushing and flossing are essential for maintaining soft tissue health. Additionally, using antiseptic mouthwash can help reduce bacteria and promote healing.
  • Regular Dental Check-ups: Routine dental examinations can help identify soft tissue problems early. These visits include deep cleanings and assessments of gum health, allowing for timely interventions when necessary.
  • Healthy Diet: Consuming foods rich in vitamins and minerals supports soft tissue strength. Fresh fruits and vegetables, dairy products, and low-fat proteins should be part of your diet to ensure optimal health.

 

Experience from the Professionals

At Dr. Ebadian’s Dental Clinic, we prioritize the beauty and health of your smile. Our expert and dedicated team utilizes the latest techniques and equipment to provide high-quality services. Among our specialties is our collaboration with celebrities and well-known figures who trust us for their dental care. This trust speaks to our quality and expertise, and we are committed to providing the best services to all our clients.

Conclusion

Our soft tissue management services at Dr. Ebadian’s Dental Clinic are an excellent choice for those who value the health and beauty of their mouths and teeth. By employing advanced techniques and the knowledge of our specialists, you can enjoy a beautiful and healthy smile. If you are seeking treatment for gum inflammation, gum grafting, or any other dental services, contact us and take advantage of our free consultations.

At Dr. Ebadian’s Dental Clinic, we are dedicated to providing the best services to improve your quality of life. Join us and enjoy the health and beauty of your teeth.
values.brief: Soft tissue management improves the health and aesthetics of gums. At Dr. Ebadian's Dental Clinic, we provide gum inflammation treatments and soft tissue grafting to keep your smile beautiful.

values.title: Ceramic and Composite Veneers
values.brief: Enhance your smile with Dr. Ebadian's ceramic and composite veneers. Discover the natural beauty and durability of ceramic veneers or the affordable and quick option of composite veneers. Contact us for expert advice and pricing details.
values.description3:
Why Dr. Ebadian?

With years of experience and expertise in cosmetic dentistry, Dr. Ebadian ensures you receive top-quality services with precision and care. Utilizing advanced technology and modern techniques, Dr. Ebadian helps you achieve the best possible results and transform your smile into a stunning reality.

Conclusion

Ultimately, choosing between ceramic veneers and composite veneers depends on your needs and preferences. Both methods can enhance your smile, but understanding their benefits and limitations will help you make the best choice. For expert advice and information on the cost of ceramic veneers and the price of composite veneers, contact us to speak with our experienced professionals.

Remember, a beautiful smile not only enhances your appearance but also boosts your confidence. By selecting the best option for your teeth, you can enjoy long-lasting benefits.
values.description2:
•  

Installation Process for Veneers

The installation process for both types of veneers generally involves the following steps:

  1. Consultation and Evaluation: Your dentist assesses your needs and recommends the most suitable option for you.
  2. Preparation: Ceramic veneers require some tooth reduction, while composites require less preparation.
  3. Application: Ceramic veneers are custom-made in a laboratory and then bonded to the teeth, whereas composites are applied and shaped directly in the dental office.
  4. Maintenance: Both types of veneers require regular dental care and hygiene to maintain their appearance and longevity.

Frequently Asked Questions

  1. Are ceramic and composite veneers suitable for everyone? Yes, but it is advisable to consult with your dentist to choose the best option based on your dental condition.
  2. Is there pain or discomfort during the process? Both methods are generally painless, but you may experience minor sensitivity after treatment, which is usually temporary.
  3. How long do ceramic and composite veneers last? Ceramic veneers typically last between 10 to 15 years, while composite veneers may need replacement or repair after 5 to 7 years.
  4. How should I care for my veneers? Regular brushing, flossing, and routine dental check-ups are essential to preserve the beauty and health of your veneers.
values.description1:
Looking to enhance the appearance of your teeth? Ceramic and composite veneers are top choices that can significantly boost your smile and self-confidence. These dental treatments not only improve the look of your teeth but also focus on their health. Read on for a comprehensive overview of these methods to make an informed decision.

Ceramic Veneers:

Beauty and Durability in One Package

Ceramic veneers are thin shells made of ceramic material that are bonded to the teeth. They have gained popularity due to their unique features:

  • Natural Beauty: Ceramic veneers offer a highly natural look due to their color and texture, mimicking real teeth effectively.
  • High Durability: These veneers resist stains and discoloration better than other types and can maintain their appearance for years without needing replacement.
  • Minimal Invasion: Installing ceramic veneers requires minimal tooth reduction, preserving the natural structure of your teeth.

The cost of ceramic veneers is generally higher than other types, but their durability and aesthetic benefits often make them a worthwhile investment.

Composite Veneers:

Affordable and Fast Option

Composite veneers are resin-based materials applied directly to the teeth and can be shaped and adjusted immediately. They are popular for the following reasons:

  • Quick Process: Composite veneer treatments are typically completed in a single visit, saving time and providing immediate results.
  • Cost-Effective: The price of composite veneers is generally lower than ceramic veneers, making them a more budget-friendly option.
  • Repairable: If a composite veneer becomes damaged, it can be repaired easily without needing full replacement.

Comparing Ceramic and Composite Veneers

Both methods have their own advantages and drawbacks. Here’s a general comparison:

  • Durability: Ceramic veneers usually last longer and are more resistant to stains and color changes compared to composites.
  • Appearance: Ceramic veneers offer a more natural look due to their visual properties, while composites may require more maintenance and periodic touch-ups.
  • Cost: Composite veneers are typically less expensive, which may appeal to those looking for a more economical solution.

values.title: Fixed Dental Prosthetics
values.brief: Discover the benefits of fixed dental prosthetics with Dr. Ebadian. Offering a natural look and reliable function, our advanced solutions provide a long-term fix for missing teeth. Contact us for details on costs and benefits.
values.description3:
Cost of Dental Prosthetics

The cost varies based on factors such as the type of prosthetic, the number of teeth replaced, and whether implants are needed. Generally, fixed prosthetics are more expensive than removable options due to their durability and functionality.

Factors Affecting Cost:

  • Type and Materials: Higher quality materials and advanced designs influence the cost.
  • Implant Requirements: Additional costs may apply if implants are necessary.
  • Dentist’s Expertise: Experienced professionals may charge more, but they deliver higher quality and precise results.

For an accurate estimate, consult your dentist to discuss your specific treatment plan.

Conclusion: Is Fixed Dental Prosthetics Right for You?

Fixed dental prosthetics offer a reliable and aesthetically pleasing way to replace missing teeth. They provide both functional and cosmetic benefits, making them a valuable option for restoring your smile.

For more information and to discuss your options, contact Dr. Ebadian. Our team is dedicated to delivering top-quality dental care and helping you achieve the best results.
values.description1:
Are you struggling with missing teeth and looking for a solution that combines aesthetic appeal with reliable function? Fixed dental prosthetics might be exactly what you need. This advanced dental restoration offers a long-term solution that enhances your smile and ensures your dental functions remain intact. In this guide, we’ll cover the details of fixed dental prosthetics, including costs and benefits, to help you make an informed decision.

What Are Fixed Dental Prosthetics?

Fixed dental prosthetics are designed to replace missing teeth. Unlike removable dentures, fixed prosthetics are securely attached to existing natural teeth or dental implants, providing a stable and durable solution.

Key Features of Fixed Dental Prosthetics:

  • Stable and Durable: Permanently attached to your teeth or implants, eliminating concerns about shifting or slipping.
  • Natural Appearance: Blends seamlessly with your natural teeth for a lifelike, aesthetically pleasing result.
  • Comfortable Use: Enjoy eating and speaking without discomfort or movement.
values.description2:
The Process of Getting Fixed Dental Prosthetics

Here’s what to expect when receiving fixed dental prosthetics:

  1. Initial Consultation: Your journey starts with a consultation where your dentist assesses your dental health and discusses your needs, providing information on treatment options.
  2. Preparation and Design: If you opt for fixed prosthetics, your dentist may prepare your teeth or place dental implants. Impressions and designs are created for your custom prosthetic.
  3. Placement and Adjustment: Your prosthetic is securely attached to your teeth or implants, with final adjustments made for a perfect fit and optimal comfort.
  4. Post-Treatment Care: Your dentist will provide guidance on caring for your new prosthetics to maximize their lifespan and maintain oral health.

Benefits of Fixed Dental Prosthetics

Fixed dental prosthetics offer numerous advantages:

  • Enhanced Aesthetics and Confidence: Achieve a natural-looking smile that boosts your self-esteem and confidence in social interactions.
  • Improved Functionality: Restore your ability to eat and speak comfortably without the hassle of removable appliances.

Long-Lasting and Stable: Provides a durable solution with secure attachment, requiring no nightly removal.

values.title: Restorative Dentistry
values.description1:
Is a broken or decayed tooth affecting your smile? Restorative dentistry is a critical branch of dental care that helps you restore damaged teeth to their natural, healthy state. With advanced restorative techniques, we can repair your broken or decayed teeth and bring back the beauty of your smile.

Why is Restorative Dentistry Important?

Your teeth are essential not only for chewing and digestion but also for the beauty of your smile and your self-confidence. A broken or decayed tooth can ruin your smile's appearance and may lead to pain and infection. Restorative dentistry helps you resolve these issues by restoring your teeth to their original, healthy condition.
values.description2:
Restorative Dentistry Services at Dr. Ebadian's Clinic

At Dr. Ebadian's clinic, we use the latest technologies and high-quality materials to offer restorative dental services at the highest standards. Our services include:

  1. Repairing Broken Teeth

A broken tooth can negatively impact both the appearance and function of your mouth. We use modern methods like dental bonding, veneers, or crowns to restore your broken teeth to their natural, beautiful state.

  1. Repairing Decayed Teeth

Tooth decay is a common issue that, if left untreated, can lead to serious infections. We use composite or amalgam fillings to repair your decayed teeth, preventing further decay and restoring your teeth’s functionality.

  1. Repairing Filled Teeth

Old fillings can wear out or break over time, requiring additional repair. At our clinic, we use high-quality materials to effectively and durably repair your filled teeth.

  1. Repairing Front and Back Teeth

Your front teeth play a major role in the aesthetics of your smile, while your back teeth are crucial for chewing. We pay special attention to both, offering tailored restorative services to meet your needs.
values.description3:
Why Choose Dr. Ebadian?

With years of experience in restorative and cosmetic dentistry, Dr. Ebadian’s clinic is one of the leading specialized centers in Tehran. We combine science and artistry to provide the best solutions for restoring your teeth. Here’s why you should choose us:

  • Expertise and Experience: Our team of restorative and cosmetic dental specialists uses the latest technologies and techniques to provide you with the highest quality care.
  • High-Quality Materials: We use top-quality restorative materials that are durable and harmonize well with your natural teeth.
  • Focus on Aesthetics: Our restorative treatments are not just about function; we prioritize the beauty and harmony of your smile.
  • Comfortable and Friendly Environment: We strive to create a calm and welcoming atmosphere for our patients, ensuring a comfortable and stress-free dental experience.

Conclusion

Restorative dentistry is essential for maintaining the health and beauty of your teeth. With the restorative dental services at Dr. Ebadian's clinic, you can effectively and durably repair your broken and decayed teeth. We help you achieve a beautiful, healthy, and lasting smile.

If you have a broken tooth, decay, or need to repair an old filling, contact us now to receive a free consultation from our specialists. Dr. Ebadian's clinic is always ready to provide you with the best restorative dental services.

Your smile is valuable; let us help you preserve it.
values.brief: Restore broken or decayed teeth with advanced techniques at Dr. Ebadian's clinic. Achieve a healthy, beautiful smile with our expert restorative dentistry services.

values.title: Cosmetic Dentistry
values.brief: Transform your smile with Dr. Ebadian’s Clinic. Explore expert cosmetic dentistry services like teeth whitening, crowns, and implants. Achieve a brighter, more confident smile. Contact us today!
values.description3:
Frequently Asked Questions

  • Is cosmetic dentistry painful? Most cosmetic dental treatments are performed using advanced techniques and local anesthesia, so minimal pain or discomfort is experienced.
  • How long does treatment take? The duration of treatment depends on the type of cosmetic service and the condition of your teeth. Some treatments may require several sessions, while others can be completed in a single visit.
  • How are treatment costs determined? The cost of treatment depends on the type of services and complexity of the procedures. An initial consultation will help provide a precise estimate of the costs.
  • Are cosmetic dental treatments permanent? Many cosmetic dental treatments offer long-lasting results, but maintaining these results requires regular care and periodic visits to the dentist.

 

Why Choose Dr. Ebadian’s Clinic?

  • Experience and Expertise Dr. Ebadian’s Clinic features a team of experienced cosmetic dental specialists who are committed to helping you achieve the best results. Using state-of-the-art techniques and advanced technology, we deliver high-quality services and exceptional outcomes.
  • Attention to Detail and High Quality We focus on every detail and ensure the quality of our services. Each stage of your treatment is carried out with precision and professionalism, ensuring satisfying and beautiful results.
  • Comfortable and Relaxing Environment At Dr. Ebadian’s Clinic, we provide a calm and pleasant environment to make your cosmetic dental experience comfortable and stress-free. Our team is attentive to your needs and comfort throughout the treatment process.
values.description1:
Are you dissatisfied with the appearance of your teeth? Have you ever considered the impact a beautiful smile can have on your life? A smile that boosts your confidence and makes every conversation and moment special. Cosmetic dentistry at Dr. Ebadian’s Clinic is your opportunity to achieve this dream. By employing the latest methods and techniques, we help you attain not only visually stunning but also emotionally uplifting results.

What is Cosmetic Dentistry?

Cosmetic dentistry is a branch of dentistry focused on improving the appearance of your teeth and smile. This specialty includes a range of treatments and techniques designed to enhance the beauty of your teeth and improve your overall oral aesthetics. With cosmetic dental services, you can achieve whiter, straighter, and more evenly spaced teeth.
values.description2:
Benefits of Cosmetic Dentistry

  • Enhanced Confidence: A beautiful smile significantly boosts your self-confidence and self-esteem.
  • Improved Appearance: Bright and well-aligned teeth enhance your overall appearance.
  • Functional Solutions: Treatments like orthodontics can address chewing and bite issues.
  • Correction of Imperfections: Composite restorations and crowns correct dental flaws and damage.
  • Long-Lasting Results: Many cosmetic treatments offer long-term, durable results with proper care.
  • Affordable Options: Advances in technology have made cosmetic dentistry more accessible with a variety of price points, making it a cost-effective investment.

 

Cosmetic Dental Services

  • Teeth Whitening: Effective methods for a brighter smile If you’re unhappy with the color of your teeth, teeth whitening may be the right solution. At Dr. Ebadian’s Clinic, we use advanced technology and professional techniques to make your teeth significantly whiter and brighter. This treatment can greatly enhance your smile and boost your confidence.
  • Dental Crowns: Restoration and beauty in one step Dental crowns are designed to cover damaged or misshapen teeth. At Dr. Ebadian’s Clinic, we use the finest materials and techniques to create and fit crowns that give your teeth a natural, beautiful appearance. These crowns not only improve the look of your teeth but also protect them from future damage.
  • Composite Restorations: Precise and natural correction Composite restorations are an excellent way to fill damaged teeth or improve their shape and appearance. These restorations blend seamlessly with your natural tooth color and provide a natural look. At Dr. Ebadian’s Clinic, we utilize advanced techniques to deliver precise and beautiful results.
  • Cosmetic Orthodontics: Improve your smile’s alignment If your teeth need straightening, cosmetic orthodontics can be an ideal solution. At Dr. Ebadian’s Clinic, we use invisible braces and other modern techniques to gradually move your teeth into their desired positions, enhancing your smile.
  • Dental Implants: Natural replacements for missing teeth If you have lost a tooth, dental implants can be an excellent option. This treatment allows you to replace missing teeth with natural-looking, beautiful implants. At Dr. Ebadian’s Clinic, we use the best materials and technology to ensure you achieve the best results.

 

Treatment Process in Cosmetic Dentistry

  • Initial Consultation Before starting any cosmetic dental treatment, an initial consultation with a cosmetic dentist is essential. During this session, your needs are assessed, and a suitable treatment plan is proposed.
  • Treatment Stages Cosmetic dental treatments typically involve several stages, including initial assessment, treatment planning, execution, and post-treatment follow-up. The duration of each stage varies depending on the type of treatment and the condition of your teeth.
  • Results and Aftercare Once the treatment is complete, the results of your cosmetic dental work will be visibly apparent. To maintain these results and ensure a quicker recovery, proper aftercare, including good oral hygiene and regular dental visits, is essential.

values.title: Biomimetic Dentistry
values.brief: Discover biomimetic dentistry—an innovative method that preserves and restores your natural teeth. With over 20 years of expertise, Dr. Ebadian provides advanced care for healthier and more youthful-looking teeth.
values.description1:
Have you ever considered how traditional dental treatments might impact the natural structure of your teeth? If you're looking for a cutting-edge approach that addresses your dental issues while preserving the integrity of your natural teeth, Biomimetic Dentistry might be the solution you've been seeking. This modern, advanced technique is revolutionizing dental care by focusing on maintaining and restoring the natural structure of your teeth. Join us to explore how this innovative approach can enhance your dental health and overall smile.

What is Biomimetic Dentistry?

Biomimetic Dentistry is a modern approach that aims to closely replicate the natural structure and function of teeth. It uses advanced materials and techniques to repair damaged teeth while preserving healthy tissue. Unlike traditional methods that may remove healthy parts, biomimetic dentistry focuses on restoring only the damaged areas. It is applicable to various procedures, including fillings, root canals, and crowns.
values.description2:
How Does Biomimetic Dentistry Differ from Traditional Dental Methods?

Traditional dental treatments typically involve removing damaged or weakened parts of a tooth and replacing them with artificial materials such as fillings, crowns, or bridges. While these approaches address immediate problems, they often result in the loss of more natural tooth structure and can compromise the long-term health of the tooth.

In contrast, Biomimetic Dentistry emphasizes the preservation and restoration of the natural tooth structure. The materials and methods used are designed to integrate seamlessly with the tooth's natural tissues, reinforcing its strength and durability. This fundamental difference makes biomimetic treatments less invasive and more enduring compared to conventional methods, leading to better long-term outcomes.

 

Key Benefits of Biomimetic Dentistry

  1. Preservation of Natural Tooth Structure

One of the standout benefits of Biomimetic Dental Care is its commitment to preserving the natural structure of your teeth. By focusing on repairing only the damaged areas and minimizing the removal of healthy tissue, biomimetic dentistry helps maintain the strength and aesthetic appeal of your teeth. This approach ensures that your teeth not only function effectively but also look natural and attractive.

  1. Enhanced Durability and Longevity

Biomimetic Dentistry also offers improved durability and longevity of dental treatments. The advanced materials and techniques used in this approach are specifically designed to strengthen and protect the natural tooth structure. This results in fewer repeat treatments and longer-lasting results, reducing the need for frequent dental visits and minimizing long-term dental costs.

  1. Natural and Aesthetic Results

Achieving a natural appearance is a primary goal in Biomimetic Dental Care. The materials employed are carefully selected to match the color, shape, and texture of your natural teeth. The result is a seamless integration where treated teeth blend effortlessly with natural ones, making any difference virtually undetectable. This allows you to smile confidently, knowing that your teeth look as natural as they feel.
values.description3:
How Biomimetic Dentistry Improves Overall Oral Health

Biomimetic Dental Care goes beyond merely preserving the structure of your teeth; it also enhances your overall oral health. By reducing the need to remove healthy tooth tissue and utilizing biocompatible materials, this approach significantly lowers the risk of infections and other dental complications. Additionally, the less invasive nature of biomimetic treatments leads to less discomfort and a faster recovery time, making the dental care experience more comfortable and efficient.

Biomimetic Medicine: Extending the Principles

The principles of biomimetic dentistry are not limited to dental care alone. Biomimetic Medicine applies similar concepts across various medical fields, aiming to create treatments inspired by the natural structures and functions of the body. This innovative approach promises to deliver less invasive and more sustainable solutions for a range of health issues, paving the way for a future of medical treatments that are both effective and minimally disruptive.

Why Dr. Ebadian is Your Top Choice for Biomimetic Dentistry

With over 20 years of outstanding experience in Biomimetic Dentistry, Dr. Ebadian is a leading expert in the field. His use of the latest techniques and state-of-the-art materials ensures that patients receive the highest level of care, resulting in healthier, stronger, and more beautiful teeth. Dr. Ebadian's precise and scientific approach means that each patient benefits from a customized treatment plan designed to meet their unique needs.

Dr. Ebadian asserts that his advanced biomimetic techniques can make you look up to 30 years younger. By choosing Dr. Ebadian, you’re placing your trust in a skilled professional dedicated to enhancing the health and aesthetics of your teeth. Experience a renewed sense of vitality and confidence through his expert care.

 

Conclusion:

Embrace the Future of Dental Care with Biomimetic Dentistry

Biomimetic Dentistry represents a revolutionary approach to dental care, focusing on preserving and restoring the natural structure of your teeth. This method not only provides natural and aesthetically pleasing results but also ensures increased durability and longevity through advanced materials and techniques. If you're looking for a solution that guarantees both the beauty and health of your teeth, Biomimetic Dentistry with Dr. Ebadian is the ideal choice.

By choosing Dr. Ebadian, you benefit from his extensive expertise and specialized knowledge in biomimetic dentistry. Trust in his experience and enjoy the confidence that comes with having healthier, more beautiful, and youthful-looking teeth. Selecting Dr. Ebadian means opting for a future with a radiant smile and enhanced self-assurance.

In this case, in addition to the aesthetic aspect, attention has been given to the treatment factors such as the length of the dental crown and the patient’s occlusal relationship.

values.title: Restoring Your Teeth
values.brief: .Restorative treatments for tooth decay vary in complexity based on severity, including fillings with amalgam, composite, or ceramic resins, and may require procedures like root canals or implants for extensive damage

values.description1:
Restorative Treatments for Tooth Decay

Surely, you have experienced filling a tooth before. When teeth develop decay, they require restoration. Restoration is a process in which the damaged or decayed part of the tooth is removed and replaced with specialized filling materials, such as composites, that can function like natural tooth tissue. These materials must possess certain characteristics to be suitable for replacing tooth structure. Tooth decay can vary in severity. Initially, decay affects a small portion of the tooth, which, if left untreated, can spread. If the decay advances, it may necessitate more complex treatments beyond simple restorative procedures.

Each tooth has multiple surfaces and a volume, and decay typically affects a specific area on one side of the tooth. It is unnecessary to treat all surfaces; only the damaged portion needs restoration.

Various treatments may be recommended for tooth damage, which we will discuss further in this article.
values.description2:
Restorative Treatments for Tooth Decay

Restorative treatments for tooth decay can vary depending on the severity of the decay. If the decay is severe and reaches the root, a root canal treatment may be necessary. In some cases, if the damage is extensive, the tooth may need to be extracted and replaced with an implant. However, if the decay is in its early stages, it can be treated with restorative procedures using various materials.

Amalgam

Tooth restoration using amalgam is a direct method. Amalgam is a flexible and strong material, though it is not tooth-colored and usually appears silver or black. Amalgam has the highest durability among restorative materials and is less expensive than composites. Its composition includes silver, tin, nickel, and mercury. Due to mercury's toxicity, the use of amalgam has been prohibited in some countries like those in Scandinavia. This treatment has become obsolete due to the health risks associated with mercury exposure.

Composite

Tooth restoration using composite is also a direct method. Composites are resin-based and paste-like materials made from various fillers, and they come in different types depending on their application. The color of composite can match the rest of a person’s teeth and comes in various shades. You can consult with your dentist to determine which composite color is suitable for you. These materials have a natural appearance due to their tooth-like color. The lifespan of composites is shorter compared to other methods. Nowadays, ceramics are used as constituent materials in composites, increasing their durability and providing a more natural appearance. This treatment is the most popular and is considered the most appropriate method for tooth restoration. However, no treatment is completely definitive.

Ceramic Resins

In this method, an impression of the teeth is taken, and based on that impression, the laboratory creates replacement parts for the decaye portions of your teeth. If the inner part of the tooth is decayed and only the inner portion is filled with ceramic materials, it is called an inlay. If the decay is on the outer part of the tooth, it is called an onlay. This method is usually used for extensive restorations because it involves a larger portion of the tooth. These ceramic fillings match the color of the tooth and have a natural appearance.

These materials can be applied using two methods: direct and indirect. Direct methods are performed directly by the dentist, while indirect methods, such as those involving composite resins, are done using a laboratory. In the indirect method, an impression of your tooth is taken, sent to the laboratory, and the restoration is fabricated for you.

 

 

Signs of Tooth Decay:

Tooth decay and cavities present various symptoms, and we have listed the most common ones below. If you notice any changes in your teeth or gums, it is best to visit a dentist, as your teeth may be affected by decay.

Here are the symptoms of tooth decay:

  • Bad breath
  • Food getting stuck between teeth
  • Toothache when applying pressure
  • Change in tooth color to brown or black
  • Fractured dental floss in decayed areas
  • Chipping or breaking of a portion of the tooth
  • Sensitivity to hot and cold temperatures when chewing food

If you observe any of these signs, it is advisable to consult a dentist.
values.description3:
:Recurring Tooth Decay After Restoration

Many people believe that once they have undergone a dental restoration, there is no need for further care and attention to the restored tooth. However, this is a misconception. Dentists recommend that post-restoration care should be even more rigorous. The more consistent and meticulous these care practices are, the longer the lifespan of the materials used in the dental restoration. It is important to note that sugary foods and carbonated beverages contribute to the deterioration and recurrence of tooth decay. Additionally, smoking and alcohol exacerbate tooth decay.

You can get your teeth restored at any reputable dental clinic. However, it is advisable to undergo a thorough examination of your teeth first to assess their overall condition and choose the best treatment option. Dr. Abadian Dental Clinic is one of the best centers that provides comprehensive information to patients about the treatment process before performing any dental restorations. Patients receive necessary counseling from their dentist in a calm environment and start the treatment process fully informed

values.brief: For expert root canal treatment and root canal therapy, visit Dr. Ebadian's clinic. Get a free consultation, professional care, and competitive pricing today.

values.description1:
When tooth decay progresses to the point where it affects the tooth root, it surpasses the scope of superficial restorative treatments and necessitates root canal treatment. This procedure involves removing the decayed portion of the tooth root and replacing it with materials that function similarly to the original root. Root canal treatment entails removing the tooth's nerve, then cleaning and shaping the pulp canal space—the central area housing the tooth's nerves and blood vessels. After undergoing this treatment, the tooth can be used without the need for replacement methods, making it a therapeutic approach aimed at preserving and maintaining teeth with extensive decay and infection. When performed correctly and promptly, root canal treatment can help maintain the health of surrounding teeth.

Root canal infections occur due to the entry and accumulation of bacteria around the tooth. As long as the tooth nerves are not completely destroyed, this condition is treatable. The dentist begins by eliminating the infection through the root canal procedure, then removes the dead tissues of the tooth. In cases where the infection is severe and has damaged the pulp canal, the dentist may need to extract the affected tooth.
values.description2:
Am I a Candidate for Root Canal Treatment?

Fine cracks, trauma, impact, and decay can cause an infection in a tooth’s root. If you have experienced any of these conditions, you may be susceptible to root canal infection. To prevent the infection from worsening or damaging other teeth, root canal treatment should be considered.

Symptoms of Root Canal Infection

The initial signs of a root canal infection include swollen gums, sensitivity to hot or cold food, and pain while chewing. If you have a root canal infection, you may experience one or more of the following symptoms, depending on the severity:

  • Fever
  • Swollen lymph nodes
  • Bad breath
  • Change in tooth color
  • Unpleasant taste in the mouth
  • Pain in the ear, neck, and face area
  • Prolonged sensitivity to cold and heat (pain persists after exposure to cold or hot stimuli)
  • Gum drainage, indicating the discharge of pus and long-term infection-causing factors

If you notice any of these symptoms, it's essential to consult a dentist promptly to determine if root canal treatment is necessary.
values.description3:
Reasons for Root Canal Infection

In a healthy tooth, the enamel and dentin protect the pulp (the tooth’s nerve chamber) from infection. However, fractures or decay can allow bacteria to penetrate and cause various diseases. Bacterial accumulation in the pulp and its spread to the tooth’s root can lead to conditions such as gum infection and abscesses.

If dental treatments are not performed correctly, it can result in problems in the mouth and teeth. Using non-hygienic methods or low-quality tools can lead to infections. Ensuring the use of high-quality and standardized tools in treatments such as orthodontics and veneers helps prevent damage and contributes to the longevity of tooth repairs.

Three Important Factors in Causing Tooth Infection:

  1. Cracks in Tooth Enamel:

    • Factors like inadequate water intake, diabetes, etc., can increase the risk of oral infections. Children and elderly individuals are more prone to root canal infections due to often prioritizing oral hygiene less.

  2. Poor Oral Hygiene:

    • Not brushing teeth after meals is a significant factor in oral diseases. Regular brushing can eliminate over 50% of plaque and dental contamination.

  3. High-Impact Sports:

    • Sports like boxing, hockey, and taekwondo can cause dental injuries. Using mouthguards during sports activities helps maintain dental health.

  4. High Sugar Intake:

    • Excessive sugar weakens the immune system and damages tooth enamel, leading to inflammation and infection.

Methods of Diagnosing Root Canal Infection

Diagnosing the extent and severity of a root canal infection is the responsibility of the dentist. When symptoms are unclear, radiography may be used to show the precise location and extent of the infection. Other diagnostic methods include:

  1. Percussion and Palpation:

    • Gently tapping the tooth and surrounding tissues or applying pressure to check for sensitivity, pain, or swelling.

  2. Thermal Testing:

    • Using hot or cold stimuli to assess sensitivity and determine if the tooth’s nerve is affected.

  3. Electric Pulp Testing (EPT):

    • Using a small electrical current to assess the vitality of the tooth’s pulp, indicating whether the nerve is functioning properly.

  4. Clinical Examination:

    • Visual inspection of the tooth for signs of decay, discoloration, swelling, or other indications of infection.

  5. Medical History and Symptoms Analysis:

    • Evaluating the patient’s medical history and discussing symptoms to gather information that may contribute to the diagnosis.

Cold and Hot Testing

This common method evaluates root canal infections. Infected teeth with vital nerves will react to cold and hot temperatures. The level and duration of pain indicate the infection's severity. Sometimes, pain is induced by applying heat to a live tooth and relieved by cooling it down.

Electric Pulp Testing

By applying a weak electrical current to the tooth’s surface, the extent of damage to the pulp can be measured. If the patient feels the electric current, it indicates that the tooth nerves are not completely damaged, and the injury is potentially reversible.

Diagnosing this condition requires specialized procedures best performed by dental specialists, who can provide more definitive treatments.

values.title: Gum surgery
values.brief: Gums play a crucial role in oral health and are essential in maintaining and enhancing the beauty of your smile. When gums suffer from disease or asymmetry, not only does the appearance of your smile deteriorate, but the health of your teeth is also compromised. Gum surgery can be a solution to these problems, restoring balance to your mouth and teeth.

values.description1:
Have you ever wondered how you could achieve a more beautiful smile and straighter teeth? Or perhaps issues like gum pain, bleeding when brushing, or gum inflammation are troubling you? Gum surgery, also known as "gingival surgery," can be the perfect solution to these problems, helping you achieve a healthy and attractive smile.

Why Is Gum Surgery Important?

Gums play a crucial role in oral health and are essential in maintaining and enhancing the beauty of your smile. When gums suffer from disease or asymmetry, not only does the appearance of your smile deteriorate, but the health of your teeth is also compromised. Gum surgery can be a solution to these problems, restoring balance to your mouth and teeth.
values.description2:
When Do You Need Gum Surgery?

Imagine that every time you brush your teeth, your gums bleed. Or when you talk and smile, your gums are overly exposed, causing a drop in your confidence. These are signs that you might need gum surgery. Some of the most common reasons for needing gum surgery include:

  • Gum Diseases: Such as gingivitis (gum inflammation) or periodontitis (advanced gum disease), which damage the gum tissue and the bone around the teeth.
  • Excessive Gum Exposure: If your gums are overly covering your teeth or are too exposed when you smile, gum surgery can correct this.
  • Prevention of Further Damage: If your gums have receded or detached from the teeth, gum surgery can prevent further damage and maintain the health of your mouth and teeth.
 

Types of Gum Surgeries

Depending on the type of gum problem, gum surgeries are divided into two main categories: therapeutic and cosmetic gum surgeries.

  1. Therapeutic Gum Surgeries:
    • Flap Surgery: This method is usually used to treat periodontitis. In this surgery, the gums are lifted from the teeth, and after thoroughly cleaning the plaque and bacteria from the tooth roots, they are repositioned.
    • Gum Grafting: This method involves taking gum tissue from other parts of the mouth or using synthetic materials to cover and strengthen the damaged gum areas.
    • Bone Grafting: Used to rebuild jawbone lost due to disease or trauma. This surgery can help preserve and strengthen the structure of the teeth.
  2. Cosmetic Gum Surgeries:
    • Gingivectomy: This method is used to reshape and align the gums, improving the appearance of your smile. Overgrown gums that cause an unattractive smile are trimmed and shaped in this procedure.
    • Gummy Smile Surgery: This surgery reduces excessive gum visibility when smiling, significantly enhancing the smile’s appearance.

Factors Affecting the Cost of Gum Surgery

One of the most common questions patients have is the cost of gum surgery. The cost depends on various factors, including:

  • Type of Surgery: Whether the surgery is therapeutic or cosmetic affects the cost. Therapeutic surgeries often cost more due to the complexity and the need for special materials.
  • Surgeon’s Expertise: The experience and specialization of the dentist significantly impact the final cost. More experienced surgeons with advanced specializations typically charge more.
  • Materials and Equipment Used: The use of special materials like grafting materials or advanced surgical equipment can increase the costs.
  • Location of the Clinic: The clinic’s location is also a factor. Clinics in different urban areas may have varying costs.

Post-Gum Surgery Care

After undergoing gum surgery, following the dentist’s recommendations is crucial to achieving the best results and speeding up recovery. Here are some important post-surgery care tips:

  • Medication: Regularly take the medications prescribed by your dentist to reduce pain and prevent infection.
  • Care for the Surgical Site: Avoid applying pressure to the surgical area, and use soft-bristled toothbrushes and mild toothpaste for cleaning.
  • Diet: In the initial days after surgery, stick to soft foods and liquids, and avoid hard, spicy, and hot foods.
  • Regular Dental Visits: Post-surgery follow-ups with the dentist are essential to assess healing progress and make necessary adjustments.
values.description3:
Why Choose Dr. Ebadian for Gum Surgery?

Choosing a dentist for gum surgery is of utmost importance. Dr. Ebadian, with his extensive experience and specialization in gum and dental surgeries, is a reliable and professional choice for those seeking the best results. The use of modern techniques, high-quality materials, and a personalized approach for each patient are among the clinic's features. Dr. Ebadian and his professional team consider each patient’s needs and conditions to provide an appropriate treatment plan, helping improve your oral health and smile aesthetics. If you're considering gum surgery or have questions, contact Dr. Ebadian’s clinic today to benefit from expert consultation and high-quality services.

 

Common Questions About Gum Surgery

  1. Is Gum Surgery Painful? Gum surgery is performed under local anesthesia, so you won't feel any pain during the procedure. After the surgery, you may experience some pain and discomfort, which can be easily managed with the painkillers prescribed by your dentist.
  2. How Long Is the Recovery Period After Gum Surgery? The recovery period depends on the type of surgery and the patient’s overall health. Typically, initial recovery occurs within 1 to 2 weeks, but complete recovery and stabilization of the final results may take several months.
  3. Are the Results of Gum Surgery Permanent? The results of gum surgery are generally long-lasting, provided that proper gum and dental care are maintained, and oral hygiene is consistently followed.

 

Conclusion

Gum surgery can significantly enhance both the beauty of your smile and your oral health. By choosing a skilled dentist and following post-surgery instructions, you can achieve a beautiful smile and healthy gums.

Are you ready to see positive changes in your smile? Contact Dr. Ebadian’s clinic today and take the first step towards a beautiful and healthy smile.

In order to match the color of the remaining teeth with these full ceramic crowns, ceramic veneers have also been used.

In this case, a significant number of missing teeth have been replaced with dental implants and full ceramic crowns. To ensure the color of the remaining teeth matches the new full ceramic crowns, ceramic veneers have also been applied.

values.description1: Orthodontics is a definitive treatment to correct misaligned teeth. It is one of the most popular dental treatments due to its aesthetic and therapeutic benefits. This treatment is recommended when teeth are irregularly positioned next to each other. Orthodontic treatment is not a quick process, and although there are faster methods to correct misaligned teeth, orthodontics is considered the most thorough and systematic approach. One of the key advantages of orthodontics over other treatments is that it corrects dental malocclusions naturally, without the need for cutting the teeth or using foreign substances. For example, using composites or laminates to correct dental irregularities involves trimming the teeth and placing a foreign material on them.
values.description2:
How is Orthodontics Done?

To determine if you are a suitable candidate for orthodontics, a specialist must perform a diagnosis. Initially, it is important to identify your specific dental issue. If you have dental malformations or concerns about tooth color, laminates might be the best treatment for you since orthodontics does not change the shape or color of teeth, but rather improves their alignment. Therefore, correctly diagnosing your problem is the first step. If you have misaligned teeth and also issues with dental malformations or tooth color, a combination treatment involving orthodontics and laminates, or orthodontics and bleaching (to correct tooth color), may be necessary. Consult your specialist dentist for the best advice.

If you suspect that you have crooked or misaligned teeth that require orthodontic treatment, your first step should be to visit an orthodontic or specialized dental clinic. After discussing your concerns with a specialist, the orthodontic treatment process will begin. The specific treatment plan will vary for each person.

Initially, the orthodontic specialist will examine your teeth and prescribe radiology images. These radiographs will provide a comprehensive set of images needed for assessment, including views of all teeth, individual teeth, canines, and posterior teeth.

Once the radiography is complete, the specialist will determine the appropriate type of orthodontic treatment based on the examination. For instance, you might be prescribed “fixed orthodontic treatment.”

The next step involves creating orthodontic molds of your teeth, which are then sent to a laboratory to fabricate the brackets. Orthodontic brackets are essential tools for the treatment, helping to align and straighten your teeth.

Finally, the orthodontic brackets are installed on your teeth.

After the installation, periodic checkups are required to monitor the braces and the progress of the treatment. Post-orthodontic care is crucial and often more important than the in-clinic treatment stages. Orthodontic treatment is a long-term process that requires patience. Following the specialist’s instructions is vital for success. For example, using dental floss and brushing after every meal are essential practices during this period. Ignoring the doctor’s advice can negatively impact your treatment plan.
values.description3:
Orthodontics for Children

Orthodontics is highly suitable for children who are in the growth phase and exhibit signs of dental irregularities. It is beneficial for children to address any irregularities in their teeth as early as possible. Young children should visit a specialist for a dental examination, and if needed, a comprehensive treatment plan should be developed.

Orthodontic treatment requires patience and cooperation with the treating physician. If your child is reluctant about this process, there are various ways to gain their cooperation. For example, you can show them pictures of their favorite celebrities with straight, uniform teeth to encourage them. Additionally, you can discuss colored orthodontics, such as pink braces, which might make the treatment more appealing to them. Using creative methods to engage your child will help ensure their satisfaction in the future, as they will grow up with straight, healthy teeth.

 

 

 

Is Orthodontic Treatment Possible at an Older Age?

Orthodontic treatment is possible at an older age, depending on factors such as the condition of the jawbone, its density, the level of skull growth, and the flexibility of the head tissues. If your physical conditions are suitable, orthodontic treatment can be effective. Even if you are beyond the optimal age, orthodontic treatment is still possible with special considerations. However, the results may take longer to achieve, which will be determined by a specialized dentist.

Which Type of Orthodontic Treatment is Suitable for Me?

There are various types of orthodontic treatments, each recommended for different cases. Here, we will briefly explain the two main types:

Fixed Orthodontics

In this method, a custom-made orthodontic device is placed inside the mouth based on the patient's oral conditions. The patient cannot remove this device. This type of treatment involves dietary restrictions because the device remains in the mouth throughout the treatment period.

Removable Orthodontics

In this method, the patient can remove the orthodontic device from their mouth, such as during eating. However, this should be done under the guidance of a specialist, as the device cannot be removed at any time. The treatment process should continue throughout the day and night.

Orthodontic treatments are also categorized based on the type of device and the model of bracket installation, each with its advantages and disadvantages. Determining which type and material is suitable for you depends on various factors, including its application and cost. During the initial consultation, the specialist will recommend the best type of orthodontics for you, considering your specific conditions.

 

 

Invisible Orthodontics for Those Concerned with the Appearance of Traditional Braces

Some individuals may not want their braces' wires and brackets to be visible for various reasons. A solution to this issue is invisible orthodontics, which is often preferred by professionals and people who frequently interact with others throughout the day. If you are concerned with the appearance of traditional braces, invisible orthodontics would be the best recommendation for you.

Orthodontic Cost

Orthodontic treatments come in various types, each with different costs. Some types are more expensive due to their additional benefits. Typically, dental orthodontics is performed on an entire jaw, meaning that it is not possible to accept the cost of orthodontics for a single crooked tooth. All the teeth of one jaw must be treated. However, single-jaw orthodontics can be an option instead of treating both jaws.

Finding the Best Orthodontist in Tehran

Orthodontics is highly sought after for its aesthetic benefits. To find the best doctor, start by reviewing their resume, education, and sample works. Examine the before and after photos of their orthodontic treatments to see the differences and determine if they meet your expectations. Additionally, ask their patients about their treatment experience, whether they achieved the desired results, and if they would recommend the doctor to others.

Orthodontics at Dr. Ebadian’s Clinic

Orthodontics requires special accuracy and sensitivity and should be entrusted to specialists with extensive knowledge and proven results. At Dr. Ebadian’s specialized dental clinic, orthodontics is a highly important treatment section. Orthodontic treatment at our clinic can completely correct the jaw structure and teeth arrangement.

You can visit our clinic for a free consultation. Our specialists will examine you and offer a personalized treatment plan. Following the treatment plan, we will schedule periodic checkups and provide continuous support throughout your treatment journey.

values.title: Dental Implant & Surgery
values.brief: Get natural-looking, long-lasting dental implants at Dr. Ebadian's clinic. Enjoy advanced techniques  and personalized care for a confident smile. Contact us today for a quote!
values.description1:
Dental Implant: An Overview

A dental implant is a type of medical device, typically made of titanium, used to replace a lost tooth. Dental and orthopedic implants are the most common types. When you lose a tooth, one of the best replacement methods is a dental implant. However, for this procedure to be viable, the density of your jawbone in the surgical area must be sufficient. If necessary, bone grafting may be performed, often referred to as a bone graft implant.

Procedure

The implant is inserted into the jawbone by a specialized surgeon. The dental replacement process involves several stages, including the placement of the implant base and subsequent steps such as molding and covering. Parts of the implant are placed inside the jawbone, acting like a natural tooth root. After this, a dental prosthesis or cover is attached to it. The combination of these components mimics the function and feel of a natural tooth, providing a healthy and functional replacement.
values.description2:
Types of Implants

Different types of implants are used based on the patient's condition:

  1. Single Tooth Replacement: If you lose one tooth, a single implant can be placed.

  2. Multiple Adjacent Teeth: If you lose two adjacent teeth, two implant bases are required. For three or more teeth, fewer bases might be needed, depending on the specific situation. This is known as an implant for adjacent teeth.

  3. Complete Jaw Replacement: For patients who lose all their teeth in one or both jaws, the treatment options depend on the dentist's diagnosis and the density of the jawbone:

    • A combination of artificial teeth and several implant bases.
    • A smaller number of implant bases with covers according to the number of teeth.
    • Denture treatment alone.

Dental implants provide a reliable and functional solution for tooth replacement, acting much like natural teeth. Whether replacing a single tooth, multiple teeth, or an entire jaw, dental implants can restore both the functionality and aesthetics of your smile. Consulting with a specialized surgeon will help determine the best treatment plan based on individual needs and jawbone density.

 

Am I a Candidate for a Dental Implant?

A suitable candidate for a dental implant is someone who has good oral and general health. The most crucial requirement is to have healthy gums without any diseases. Since the implant is placed into the jawbone, having adequate and healthy bone tissue is essential.

If you have any of the following conditions, dental implant surgery may not be recommended:

  • Weak immune system
  • Age under 16
  • Specific diseases such as cancer and hepatitis
  • Incomplete skull bone growth and incomplete tooth development
  • Pregnancy (implant surgery should only be performed with a doctor’s approval during pregnancy)
  • Uncontrolled diabetes (controlled diabetes through medication or diet is usually not a problem)
  • History of severe heart issues, heart attack, or heart surgery (consult with a cardiovascular specialist before considering implant surgery)

Advantages of Dental Implants

Despite the high cost, dental implants offer numerous benefits, such as:

  1. Comfort and Practicality: Implants provide a natural chewing ability and comfort, making them more satisfying compared to fixed bridges or removable dentures.

  2. Durability: With proper care and attention to hygiene, dental implants can last a lifetime without the need for replacement.

  3. Preservation of Other Teeth: Implant treatment does not require sacrificing adjacent teeth, unlike some other dental procedures.

  4. Health Benefits:

    • Gum Health: Implants fill the cavity left by a missing tooth, preventing bacterial infiltration and gum disease.
    • Preventing Dental Issues: Implants reduce the risk of inflammation and gum infections by providing a quick and effective tooth replacement.

  5. Aesthetic Appeal: Implants look very similar to natural teeth, maintaining the beauty of your smile and boosting confidence, especially when replacing front teeth.

  6. Improved Pronunciation: Missing teeth can affect your ability to pronounce words correctly. Implants help restore proper speech.

  7. Enhanced Comfort and Digestion: Implants allow you to chew food more effectively, preventing digestive issues and offering greater comfort compared to dentures.

 

Dental implants are a superior method for tooth replacement due to their durability, health benefits, aesthetic appeal, and comfort. While they come at a higher cost, the advantages they offer make them a worthwhile investment for many patients. Always consult with your dental specialist to determine the best treatment plan based on your individual health and dental condition.
values.description3:
Advantages of Dental Implants

Compared to other tooth replacement methods, dental implants cause minimal damage. However, using substandard implants or having a dentist with insufficient expertise can lead to complications. Some potential disadvantages include:

  1. Implant Fracture: Although rare, some implant brands may break if subjected to high pressure or heavy impact. Unfortunately, a fractured implant cannot be repaired.

  2. Implant Coating Detachment: While the implant body itself remains fixed, excessive pressure can cause the coating to come off. If this happens, you should see your dentist promptly.

  3. Infection: Infection during implant treatment is rare. However, improper implant placement might necessitate removal by the dentist. Pain or sensitivity might be mistaken for an infection by patients.

  4. Loosening of the Implant Screw: Though uncommon, issues such as teeth grinding, eating hard foods, or biting on hard objects can cause the implant screw to loosen.

Post-Implant Care: Six Key Points

  1. Avoid Manipulating the Surgical Area: Refrain from touching or disturbing the surgical site after the procedure.

  2. Dietary Precautions: Avoid chewing hard foods and fruits for a month following the implant surgery.

  3. Medication Adherence: Follow the prescribed medication regimen, as it is tailored to your condition and aids in the success of the treatment.

  4. Oral Hygiene: Keep the surgical site clean by brushing with physiological saline after each meal.

  5. Regular Check-Ups: Attend all scheduled dentist appointments to prevent potential issues such as implant infection.

  6. Use Approved Oral Care Products: If recommended by your dentist, use mouthwash, a toothbrush, and dental floss specifically designed for implants to reduce infection risk.

Considering Gum Surgery

Gum surgery is necessary when gum tissue cannot be treated with conventional methods. The primary reasons include gum infections and periodontitis.

Types of Gum Surgery

  1. Flap Surgery:

    • Purpose: Reduces gum pockets formed due to infections or inflammation.
    • Procedure: The dentist makes an incision, removes the infection, and then stitches the gum back up. This surgery can also address bone defects or loss.

  2. Crown Lengthening Surgery:

    • Purpose: Corrects excessive gum tissue growth, known as a “gummy smile.”
    • Procedure: Excess gum tissue is removed to enhance the natural appearance of teeth.

  3. Soft Tissue Graft Surgery:

    • Purpose: Used when the gum line is higher than usual.
    • Procedure: Soft tissues from the palate or roof of the mouth are grafted onto the affected areas to improve appearance and protect tooth roots.

  4. Gum Restoration Surgery:

    • Purpose: Addresses gum recession.
    • Procedure: After removing any infection, stimulating proteins are applied to encourage new tissue growth.

  5. Bone Grafting:

    • Purpose: Replaces lost jawbone tissue.
    • Methods:
      • Autogenous Bone Graft: Bone is taken from another part of the patient’s body.
      • Allograft: Uses bone or soft tissue from another person, or artificial bone from a laboratory.
    • Application: Often necessary for patients with insufficient bone density for implants.

  6. Laser Therapy:

    • Purpose: Removes plaque and bacteria causing gum inflammation and bleeding.
    • Procedure: Uses laser light to clean the root surfaces and remove bacteria without cutting or tissue removal.

Postoperative Gum Care

  1. Dietary Precautions: Avoid hot, spicy, and crunchy foods; opt for liquid foods like soup.
  2. Cold Therapy: Use an ice pack immediately after surgery to reduce inflammation.
  3. Cold Drinks: Help cool the mouth and reduce gum inflammation.
  4. Medication: Only use prescribed pain relievers.
  5. Wound Care: Avoid touching, brushing, or chewing near the bandaged wounds.
  6. Physical Activity: Minimize physical exertion and avoid hot weather or intense sunlight.
  7. Sensitivity Management: You may experience sensitivity to stimuli like toothpaste or hot and cold food. If sensitivities persist, inform your dentist.

Proper postoperative care is crucial to prevent infections and ensure a successful recovery. Regular follow-ups with your dentist will help monitor healing and address any concerns promptly.

For further advice and consultation, consider contacting specialists at Dr. Ebadian Clinic for the best treatment options.

values.title: Combined Treatments
values.undefined: These are patients who require combined treatments for their dental abnormalities. In this case, a large number of missing teeth have been treated with dental implants and full ceramic crowns. In order to match the color of the remaining teeth with these full ceramic crowns, ceramic veneers have also been used.
values.treatment: Combination of implant treatment, ceramic veneers, full ceramic crowns
values.description:
Combined Treatments
Description: These patients require a combination of treatments for their dental abnormalities. In this case, a significant number of missing teeth have been replaced with dental implants and full ceramic crowns. To ensure the color of the remaining teeth matches the new full ceramic crowns, ceramic veneers have also been applied.

values.brief: .Laminates are dental coverings that enhance teeth appearance and can last up to ten years with proper care, but may need replacement after several years
values.description1: "Dental cosmetics" refers to procedures that ultimately lead to healthy and beautiful teeth. In other words, cosmetic dentistry is a branch of dentistry that focuses on improving both the function and appearance of a person's teeth. Any actions taken to achieve healthy and attractive teeth, such as bleaching, cleaning, and polishing, fall under the category of cosmetic dentistry.
values.description2:
Teeth Whitening for Aesthetic Purposes

Teeth whitening is an effective method for enhancing the appearance of teeth. Bleaching, which can be done both at home and in a clinic, is one such method. When performed in a dental clinic, there are different approaches for live teeth (completely healthy teeth) and non-living teeth (damaged teeth).

 

which include: 

Whitening Live Teeth in the Dental Clinic:

At Dr. Ebadian’s clinic, the procedure begins by applying a thick 40% hydrogen peroxide solution to the teeth for a few minutes. Next, the teeth are exposed to laser light or special lamps, which enhances the effectiveness of the whitening agent. This teeth whitening process should be repeated 3 to 4 times, with a one-week interval between each session.

Whitening Non-Vital or Restored Teeth in the Clinic:

For this procedure, a cavity is created in the tooth to accommodate the whitening gel. The gel is left inside the tooth for one hour before being removed. Similar to the treatment for live teeth, this method should be repeated 3 to 4 times, with a one-week interval between each session, to achieve visible results.

Dental Cleaning

The buildup of plaque and bacteria on teeth can lead to stains and discoloration. Dental cleaning involves a dentist removing plaque and debris from the teeth using specialized cleaning tools. This process helps reduce bacterial penetration into the teeth and lowers the risk of tooth decay.

However, dental cleaning cannot remove internal stains. For deep stains, other methods such as bleaching are necessary to enhance the appearance of your teeth.

Dental cleaning can be performed in two ways: manually or with an ultrasonic device. To learn more about the dental cleaning process, its side effects, and aftercare, please visit the dental cleaning page.

 

 

Tooth Polishing

Another process that enhances the beauty of teeth is polishing. The dentist begins by cleaning the surface of the teeth with a brush, then removes plaque and tartar using a special paste called prophylaxis paste, resulting in a smooth surface. As shown in the picture below (before and after tooth polishing), this method is suitable only for teeth with surface stains. Tooth polishing has various types and serves different purposes, including:

  • Surface polishing
  • Therapeutic polishing
  • Cosmetic polishing
  • Selective polishing

Types of Dental Cosmetic Procedures

Ultimately, all procedures performed in a dental clinic aim to beautify your teeth and smile, such as orthodontics, laminates, implants, and more. Dr. Ebadian’s dental clinic can help you achieve the most beautiful smiles in the shortest possible time.
values.description3:
Laminates and Their Lifespan

Laminates are a popular dental covering that has proven effective for many years. Many people worldwide use this cosmetic dental procedure to achieve beautiful, white, and well-shaped teeth. Laminates can effectively conceal cracks, misshapen teeth, and yellow or black stains, enhancing the overall appearance of your teeth. However, if someone is not satisfied with the results of laminates or wishes to remove them for any reason, what should be done? The first thought that comes to mind is probably removing the dental laminates.

Since laminates are external additions to the body, they have a limited lifespan. Although this lifespan can sometimes approach ten years, laminates may deteriorate over time, diminishing the teeth's appearance. The lifespan of laminates depends on numerous factors, with the precision of their fabrication being just one of them.

The most crucial factor in extending the lifespan of laminates is proper care. This includes avoiding substances such as cigarettes and alcohol, not biting hard materials, refraining from consuming very hot or cold drinks, and regularly using a toothbrush and dental floss, ideally two to three times a day. However, even with these precautions, laminates can still encounter problems. Consequently, many people wonder if laminates cause tooth decay.

The truth is that tooth decay does not solely depend on the presence of laminates. Some people mistakenly believe that laminates are as strong as natural teeth and test them by biting hard objects. Laminates are primarily a cosmetic dental procedure that makes your teeth look natural but does not necessarily enhance their strength. Therefore, if you have used laminates incorrectly, the issue may not be with the laminates themselves. It is also normal for laminates to chip or decay after a few years.
